qas.question: The highest portion of the Alp's range is divided by what?

answers.text: the glacial trough of the Rhone valley

qas.question: Where are the peaks smaller in the range?
The Bernese Alps are located in what part of the range?

context: The highest portion of the range is divided by <a0_0>the glacial trough of the Rhone valley<a0_0/>, with the Pennine Alps from Mont Blanc to the Matterhorn and Monte Rosa on the southern side, and the Bernese Alps on the <a2_0>northern<a2_0/>. The peaks in <a1_0>the easterly portion<a1_0/> of the range, in Austria and Slovenia, are smaller than those in the central and western portions.
